summary: This is a 2021 email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office and FedEx's legal department regarding the identification of a records custodian to authenticate FedEx records from 2008 for use in the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. The records relate to a subpoena response from February 2008 in the Southern District of Florida's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal at Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx employee corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office to assist in identifying a records custodian and authenticating FedEx records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the upcoming criminal trial in New York for which the FedEx records are being authenticated.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by Tracy Chapell in an email asking if the records pertain to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the underlying investigation is related to him.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx employee who was the point of contact for a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

connections.description: The document context implies their legal cases are connected, as records from the Epstein investigation are being authenticated for use in Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx in Epstein investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida served a subpoena on FedEx as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled trial of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Authentication of FedEx records for trial
events.description: In July 2021, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York corresponded with FedEx to identify a records custodian to authenticate 2008 FedEx records for use in the Maxwell trial.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: In 2021, prosecutors were preparing for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial by authenticating FedEx records from a 2008 subpoena related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The 2008 subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, indicating federal investigative activity into Epstein at that time.
A FedEx paralegal explicitly asked if the records pertained to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the notoriety and central role of Epstein in the underlying matter.
The correspondence shows procedural steps taken by law enforcement to establish a chain of custody and authentication for business records to be used as evidence in a major criminal trial.
